title: Properly account for TMPDIR and datalad.tests.temp.dir
body:
This is a follow up on #4708, which made sure, that `datalad/utils.py:get_tempfile_kwargs` uses `TMPDIR` as a default when `DATALAD_TESTS_TEMP_DIR` isn't set. While this is an improvement it actually is the wrong place to honor that config in the first place, which should be honored by helpers in `datalad/tests/utils.py` instead, while actual datalad code that may use `get_tempfile_kwargs` should rely on `TMPDIR` but not on `DATALAD_TESTS_TEMP_DIR`. Furthermore, we only ever read this setting from env var although it's supposed to be a config that also can be read from config files (`ConfigManager`). Therefore, this PR

 - sets the default `datalad/utils.py:get_tempfile_kwargs` to `TMPDIR` and let the test helpers call it by getting the value for `datalad.tests.temp.dir` from `ConfigManager` and pass it via the `dir` argument.
 - fixes `has_symlink_capabilities` to respect `datalad.tests.temp.dir` and thereby test the location the tests are actually supposed to run in
 - results in fixing `get_most_obscure_supported_filename` for the same effect

Looking through the tests there are several similar issues fixed in the process:

 - fixes several issues in the tests, where we only considered an env var, when we should read a config
 - make use of `patch_config` in several places, since patching environment to test the effect of configs wasn't always correct and can have side effects on other tests
